passages.text: China (PRC) | Consumer Staples
Inner Mongolia Yili Industrial Group

Yili's 2Q25 was strong and the co keeps leading market position across multiple business. Mgmt maintained their 2025 full- year guidance and expects to achieve NPM target of \(9.0\%\) in 2025. PT stays at Rmb35. Maintain Buy and we prefer Yili to Mengniu in China Dairy on attractive dividend yield, valuation and better growth/recovery trajectory across sectors.

Revenue came in at Rmb28.9bn, up by \(5.8\%\) YoY, among which: 1) UHT liquid milk saw a narrower YoY drop in 2Q vs. 1Q (vol stable and ASP down), 2) chilled milk +MSD- HSD \(0\%\) growth, 3) IMF +HSD% growth and adult milk powder +DD% growth, 4) cheese +DD \(0\%\) growth and 5) ice cream \(+38\%\) growth, thanks to low base effect, favorable weather condition in 2Q and strong demand in mid- price range products. - GPM of \(34.4\%\) expanded by 0.53pct YoY thanks to favorable raw milk price trend. - S&D expense ratio improved (decreased) by 0.68pct YoY to \(19.9\%\) - Core OPM expanded by 0.65pct YoY to \(9.3\%\) on GPM improvement and S&D expense saving.

Yili keeps leading market position across multiple sectors in 1H25. For example, Yili ranked No.1 in terms of company share in overall liquid milk, also in UHT milk. Yili positioned top in terms of company share in overall milk powder, notably, the co's market share was \(18.1\%\) \((+1.3\) pct YoY) in China IMF as No.1. Yili was also a top player in ice cream in terms for market share.

Mgmt maintained their guidance during the 1H25 earnings call. To recap, mgmt expects 2025 revenue and PBT to achieve at Rmb119.0/12.6bn with \(2.8 / 24.4\%\) growth, respectively (mentioned in the 2024 annual report). To achieve this target, mgmt expects: 1) to see higher than industry avg growth for liquid milk, 2) to keep channel inventory healthy and 3) to provide value- for- money dairy products to consumers in the backdrop of soft consumer demand. Besides, NPM is expected to achieve \(9.0\%\) target this year per mgmt.

Model revisions: Intil's update, we keep our ests largely intact but trim earnings by \(1 - 4\%\) for 2025- 27E with factoring in the co's donation in IMF (as non- OP expense) in 2Q with NPM in line with mgmt's guidance. PT stays at Rmb35, implying \(18.3x / 17.6x\) for 2026/27E. Yili is currently trading at 4.9x/14.3x for 2026E/27E and dividend yield \(\sim 4.1\%\) . Maintain Buy, and we prefer Yili to Mengniu on attractive dividend yield, valuation and better growth/recovery trajectory across sectors.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 4-9 of this report. \\* Jefferies Hong Kong Limited

FY (Dec)CHANGE TO JEFEJEF vs CONS2025202620252026REVNANANMNMEPS-4%-1%-7%-3%
Chart 1 - Raw milk price down by \(10.6\%\) YTD, stabilizing gradually
Chart 2 - In 1H25, Yili's company share increased to \(18.1\%\) in China IMF, ranking No.1
Source: Company data, compiled by JEF

Investment Thesis / Where We Differ- According to "Global Dairy Top 20," published by Rabobank in 2021, Yili is the largest dairy name in China by sales. Its core strengths are a stable management team and strong execution, which help it continue to lead industry growth.- The company plans to emphasize IMF product expansion. We expect IMF's high growth to drive the company's sales growth and margin improvement.- We are more conservative than the market on Yili's margin expansion due to the consolidation of Ausnutria.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Base Case, CNY35,+23%- We expect a stable macro environment. Sales volume of dairy products rises by mid- to- high- single digit over the next few years. Consumers trade up for premium products. Competition is stable over the next three years.- Raw milk price overall 2025 better YoY.- DCF- based PT of Rmb35.

Upside Scenario, CNY42,+47%- Macro environment is better than expected. Dairy sales volume growth accelerates, helped by rising consumer income, especially for high- end products, such as pasteurized milk and high- end UHT. Competition eases over the next three years, helped by strong demand.- Yili's IMF sales growth is faster than expected. Its margin continues to expand, helped by better- than- expected product mix upgrade and cost control.- DCF- based PT of Rmb42.

Downside Scenario, CNY20,- 30%- Dairy sales volume growth decelerates or declines due to a weaker- than- expected macro environment. Consumers trade down to lower- end products. Competition intensifies between Mengniu and Yili, which leads to heavy price competition.- Costs increase significantly on raw material price inflation and Yili is unable to pass on the rising cost due to intensifying competition.- Key management changes lead to deterioration in operating efficiency. Operating margin declines on intensifying competition and lower operating efficiency.- DCF- based PT of Rmb18.

Top Material Issue(s):1) Food safety. Maintaining product quality and safety is crucial, as dairy products are sold directly to consumers. Quality control is necessary, and potential negative events such as product recalls can harm brand image. 2) Supply chain management is also key, as the co relies on a Qriety of contract farmers and suppliers. 3) Environmental and social impacts, incl deforestating, land use, animal welfare, etc., are also critical.

CompanyTarget(s): 1) Achieve effective green transformation across the industry chain, and organization- level energy utilization to reach an international leading level by 2030. 2) Achieve green, low- carbon recycling, with a clean, low- carbon, safe, and effective energy system, with industry chain energy utilization reaching an international leading level by 40. 3) Achieve carbon neutrality for the entire industry chain by 50.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) On supply chain management, how do you ensure your suppliers comply with your environment management requirement, and ensure product quality? 2) How much expense do you expect to incur to achieve your mid- long term ESG targets?

Catalysts- Liquid milk: consumer recovery in plain milk, turnaround of UHT yogurt, growth in chilled milk and yogurt- IMF: Operation updates- Cheese: 2B business development and penetration increase in 2C business- Earnings releases- Price hikes- M&A activities
Chart 3 - Financials (Yili) (in Rmb mn, YE Dec)
Source: Company data, JEFe
Ratio Analysis202320242025E2026E2027EGrowth (%)Revenue2%-8%3%5%4%Gross profit3%-5%6%5%5%EBIT (JEF)15%15%-2%9%8%Net Profit11%-19%27%14%4%

Yili Dairy is one of the biggest dairy product manufacturers in China by sales. It mainly manufactures and distributes dairy products and health drinks, with major product categories including liquid milk, milk beverage, milk formula, ice cream, yogurt, health drinks and cheese. Its major brands include "Satine", "Ambrosial", "Joy Day", "Chocliz" and "Pro- Kido". The company distributes its products nationwide and overseas. The company was listed on the Shanghai Stock Exchange in 1996.

We value Yili based on a fundamental DCF approach, factoring in a discount rate of \(9.5\%\) ( \(3.9\%\) risk- free rate, \(5.6\%\) equity premium, \(1.0x\) beta, debt- free capital structure) and a terminal growth rate of \(2\%\) . Risks to our price target include higher- than- expected raw material cost, intense competition, management changes, and food safety issues.

We value Mengniu based on a fundamental DCF approach, factoring in a discount rate of \(9.5\%\) ( \(3.9\%\) risk- free rate, \(5.6\%\) equity premium, \(1.0x\) beta, debt- free capital structure) and a terminal growth rate of \(2\%\) . Risks to our price target include intensified competition, goodwill/trademark value impairment on milk powder business, management changes, unsuccessful M&A consolidation, and food safety issues.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated
securities with an average security price consistently below \(10, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus 20% or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/rowth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise PicksJefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
